data.event: Schaumburg trustees Tuesday approved a site plan for a 34,000-square-foot Crate & Barrel store at the intersection of Woodfield and Martingale roads.
It joins an already approved 65,000-square-foot Whole Foods on the former site of the John M. Smyth Homemakers building razed last summer.
Community Development Director Christopher Huff said the Whole Foods is expected to begin above-ground construction this spring, with the Crate & Barrel next door to begin shortly after.

event.title: both projects have been in the pipeline for a few years

data.event: Though both projects have been in the pipeline for a few years, their going forward at this point is seen as a very significant step.

event.title: a pretty big deal because we're down about two-thirds from what we were at a year

data.event: "It's a pretty big deal because we're down about two-thirds from what we were at a year and a few months ago," Huff said.

event.title: a few months ago," Huff said

data.event: "It's a pretty big deal because we're down about two-thirds from what we were at a year and a few months ago," Huff said.
But last summer they said they've had a policy of moving their houseware stores from malls to larger, separate lots in order to sell furniture as well.
